page.title: 11Use of Bury St. Edmunds.
page.content: Bury St. Edmunds town centre is within easy walking distance and we mainly use it for shopping, especially on market days, Wednesday and Saturday. The main problem is parking and this is much worse on market days. Our services such as hairdressing are usually in town and we might go down to the library. There are museums to visit, a lot of restaurants including a vegetarian one and an Indian one. If we go down to the Abbey Gardens we can play games, look at the monkeys, watch the ducks, picnic or just sit. Nearby is the Cathedral where people go to worship and we can take our visitors to admire the building. In the evening adults might go down town to the snooker club,the pubs or to "Taps" disco.
